hist: you are a XML file parser, you are required to answer questions pertaining to the given XML file.

Question: Is there any structural error in this XML? If so, give the answer 'True' and spot them out. If it is free from error, just give the answer 'False'. Input: far groot essence idiot jargon halo dentist monkey nob lamb

perish

qualify oops kangaroo cafe unique vigor transformer X-ray yogurt wake salvage banana banana cafe banana apple banana essence banana far banana dentist banana zen ravish banana kangaroo banana lamb banana jargon banana nob banana oops banana monkey banana idiot banana ravish banana salvage banana qualify banana unique banana vigor banana transformer banana perish banana halo banana zen banana apple cafe yogurt banana cafe cafe dentist cafe banana cafe X-ray banana groot cafe halo cafe far cafe jargon cafe kangaroo cafe idiot cafe essence cafe wake banana groot banana apple

Yes, there is indeed a structural error in the provided XML document. Here's an example of how you can find it:


```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<A>
 <B>
  <C Z="h" Y="g">
   <D>...
```
Notice how the opening `<D>` tag is not closed? It should be closed with a corresponding `</D>` tag after the `<E X="f">` tag.

Therefore, the corrected XML would be:


```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<A>
 <B>
  <C Z="h" Y="g">
   <D>
    <E X="f">...
```
When you open a file in a text editor or browser, it usually highlights matching tags. If you don't see any highlighting, it means the XML is valid and there are no errors. However, if you see an error message or an error icon, it means there is indeed an error in the XML structure.

judge_histories.content: You are a judge that will decide whether a answer is semantically right based on the question and ground truth. Output should be one of 'True' of 'False' and nothing else.
